
# Ecosystem Game
**The code for this game cannot be made public for academic plagarism purposes**
Welcome to Ecosystem Game, an interactive and dynamic game where different critters inhabit a 2D grid. In this game, you'll encounter a variety of critters, each with unique behaviors and actions. The goal is to observe their interactions and see how they survive and thrive in their environment. 

Each critter has unique time skip function where some reproduce, move, or stay still. Every critter loses a set amount of energy each time skip. If this level drops below 0, they perish. Each critter also has a fight functios. Fights occur when critters land in the same space on the 2D grid. Critters also have unique fight functions where they can choose to run or fight. If they choose to fight, there is a random number roll and the critter that gets the higher number wins the fight and the other perishes.

**Critter Types:**

**Clover:** Clovers will spawn randomly and automatically lose fights. If a critter consumes a clover, they will gain a set amount of energy

**Rat:** When spawned, every time step the rat will run a random direction. Rats will always fight.

**Spider:** Spiders always runs to the right. When it fights another critter it will reproduce a new spider to its right.

**Lumberjack:** Lumberjacks will run north if it has more than 100 energy, otherwise walk. They will always fight if landed on.

**Maiden:** Maidens will reproduce if it has more than 200 energy, creating an adjacent child in a random direction. Otherwise the Maiden will walk in hopes of getting more energy. Runs away if landed on.

**Goblin:** Goblins will take one step in any direction and reproduce if they have more than 150 energy. Goblins will also fight if landed on.

Ecosystem Game provides an engaging and interactive experience, giving you insight into the dynamics of a simulated critter ecosystem. The game allows you to explore the behaviors of various critters, their interactions, and the impact of time on their survival.

The game is run through the main file. All other files are to support the game. In order to create a new critter, a new java file will have to be made. This is because the main.java file will parse all files in src and add only those of type critter.
## Tech Stack

**Language:** Java

**Libraries:** JavaFX
## Features

**Dynamic Critter Display:** Critters are displayed on a 2D grid, each represented by a distinct character or graphical element. You can explore the grid and observe the critters' behaviors and interactions.

**Time Skipping:** By pressing a button, you can initiate a time skip, advancing the game by one time step. Each critter has a different action during a time skip, such as reproducing, fighting, moving, or losing health. These actions bring the game to life and showcase the diverse nature of the critters.

**Energy and Survival:** During each time step, critters lose a set amount of energy. If their energy level drops below zero, they die and disappear in the next time step. It's important to observe their energy levels and ensure their survival.

**Fight and Flee:** When critters encounter each other on the grid, a random number is chosen to determine the outcome of their interaction. The critter with the higher number wins, and the defeated critter dies. However, critters have the ability to flee during a fight, adding an element of strategy and unpredictability.

**Animate Feature:** The game also includes an animate feature, allowing you to witness multiple time steps within a second. You can adjust the number of time steps per second and even pause the animation to observe critters' behaviors more closely.
